title: Frank Lampard issues Christian Pulisic transfer update amid Chelsea exit talk
text:

Frank Lampard insists Christian Pulisic will not be leaving Chelsea in January.

Pulisic, 21, has struggled for regular match action since joining Chelsea from Borussia Dortmund.

The US international had been earmarked as a potential replacement for Eden Hazard but Lampard has preferred other options so far this term.

There have been suggestions Pulisic would look for a loan move when the transfer window opens in January but Lampard is having none of it.

"With Christian he’s come to us in a big move, let’s make no mistake about it, and then he’s just turned 21 recently, and we’ve got a competitive squad here," he said.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

"I said it before the last game, I always have a problem who to pick and people make my decisions in training or how they’re playing, and at the minute with winning four on the bounce I need the edge of staying in the team and keep performing and everyone is the same.

"As with every player in the squad, needs to work hard in training, keep improving in training, see the direction we’re going, be a part of it, and show what you can do on a match day, and all the players are the same there."

Another player who has found his opportunities limited this season is Spanish winger Pedro.

(Image: Getty Images)

SPORT reports the former Barcelona star is considering his future at Stamford Bridge after losing his place in the side.

Pedro's children have returned to Spain with his ex-wife and he is keen to receive assurances from Lampard over his role within the Chelsea squad.

Chelsea return to Premier League action against Newcastle at Stamford Bridge on Saturday.
description: US international Christian Pulisic has been linked with a January loan move after struggling for game time at Chelsea
